text:
I was trying to find the melody that plays in the ancient wind and water caves.....i though this was it but it taint no aint noes nones not aint any isnts...help?.....

...and in real life alien raiders from the sky probably will pump an infectious radioactive mist into our atomosphere....from their floating holographic-ally cloaked cities......and only the oldest trees on earth will be able to detoxify it....by this time many a humanoids will have taken to a sim-seru like virus/chip implant....very mechanical in nature like a cyborg transhuman......and then another group will remember the energy used to communicate with the animals and they will take quite a different trans-evolutionary path.......similar to the story of legaia

text: Amazing game. I am a lucky guy to have known this game! :) not many people know, unfortunately. I remember when I used to play it, I was little and my two brothers used to watch me playing, althought we didn't understand english very well we figured out some of the story of the game. Not counting the soundtrack, one of the bests!

author: YAG ANNATH

text: Legaia 2 had NO marketing. It was owned by Eidos at the time, a company that was failing left and right by that time. Legaia was too dormant and the series was never popular anyway. It's only well known amongst JRPG enthusiasts. It deserved better.
author: xOmniCloudx

text: Whoa, hello there, guess who finally FINALLY caught up in your playlist? Me. And can I say that this has been a pleasant experience listening to the video game music you've personally have picked. Sure, there's some games that I wish had representation (wow, expected more Pokemon!), but I don't mind in the long run because of how much I'm being exposed to songs I would have never listened to otherwise! Thanks, please don't stop being really freaking cool. Rock on Supra, rock on.

text: This game had a marvelous soundtrack and it really helped to further pull you into the game. I, too, am saddened that the sequel pretty much buried any chance for this series to continue, but it did not tarnish the legacy of the first game for me.

text:
This is one of those games that's a true gem. Not perfect, no, but lots of fun and really felt... different compared to all the other RPGs of the time. This would be a GREAT game to get some sort of update/remix. Give it some attention. Some attention it definitely deserves.

Thanks!

author: Landbeorht

text: I really liked this game, it has a really unique atmosphere and I loved the battle system with its combo moves. It's too bad Legaia 2 failed and killed this series. As for the Microsoft conference, I said yesterday I didn't expect much software and unfortunately, I was right. Today's conference was one of the most boring I've seen in a while: Kinect, watching TV, sports channels, EA sports and Call of Duty. I'm giving MS the chance to show their games at E3, but for now... hello PS4.
author: SupraDarky
